metadata.title: CVE-2023-32250 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the processing ofSMB2_SESSION_SETUP commands. The issue results from the lack of properlocking when performing operations on an object. An attacker can leveragethis vulnerability to execute code in the context of the kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32250` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-generic-64k - 5.15.0-94.104
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-94.104').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1050.55').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1053.58').
linux-azure package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-1055.63').
linux-azure-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-6.2, was needs-triage').
